sn22.126:1.2.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā …pe… ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn22.126:1.2.eng: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn22.126:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘ignorance’.

sn22.126:1.5.eng: And how is an ignorant person defined?”

sn22.126:2.1.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, assutavā puthujjano samudayadhammaṃ rūpaṃ ‘samudayadhammaṃ rūpan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti;
sn22.126:2.1.eng: “Mendicant, it’s when an unlearned ordinary person doesn’t truly understand form, which is liable to originate, as form which is liable to originate.

sn22.126:2.2.eng: They don’t truly understand form, which is liable to fall, as form which is liable to fall.

sn22.126:2.3.eng: They don’t truly understand form, which is liable to originate and fall, as form which is liable to originate and fall.

sn22.126:2.11.eng: consciousness, which is liable to originate, as consciousness which is liable to originate.

sn22.126:2.12.eng: They don’t truly understand consciousness, which is liable to fall, as consciousness which is liable to fall.

sn22.126:2.13.eng: They don’t truly understand consciousness, which is liable to originate and fall, as consciousness which is liable to originate and fall.

sn22.126:2.15.eng: And this is how an ignorant person is defined.”

sn22.126:3.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn22.126:3.1.eng: When he said this, the mendicant said to the Buddha:

sn22.126:3.2.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘knowledge’.

sn22.126:3.4.eng: And how is a knowledgeable person defined?”

sn22.126:4.1.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako samudayadhammaṃ rūpaṃ ‘samudayadhammaṃ rūpan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
sn22.126:4.1.eng: “Mendicant, it’s when a learned noble disciple truly understands form, which is liable to originate, as form which is liable to originate.

sn22.126:4.2.eng: They truly understand form, which is liable to fall, as form which is liable to fall.

sn22.126:4.3.eng: They truly understand form, which is liable to originate and vanish, as form which is liable to originate and vanish.

sn22.126:4.11.eng: consciousness, which is liable to originate, as consciousness which is liable to originate.

sn22.126:4.12.eng: They truly understand consciousness, which is liable to fall, as consciousness which is liable to fall.

sn22.126:4.13.eng: They truly understand consciousness, which is liable to originate and fall, as consciousness which is liable to originate and fall.

sn22.126:4.15.eng: And this is how a knowledgeable person is defined.”

sn22.127:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
sn22.127:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana. …

sn22.127:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito …pe… ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:

sn22.127:1.3.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘ignorance’.

sn22.127:1.5.eng: And how is an ignorant person defined?”

sn22.127:2.1.pli: “Idhāvuso assutavā puthujjano samudayadhammaṃ rūpaṃ ‘samudayadhammaṃ rūpan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti; vayadhammaṃ rūpaṃ …pe… ‘samudayavayadhammaṃ rūpan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
sn22.127:2.1.eng: “Reverend, it’s when an unlearned ordinary person doesn’t truly understand form, which is liable to originate … liable to fall … liable to originate and fall, as form which is liable to originate and fall.

sn22.127:2.2.pli: Samudayadhammaṃ vedanaṃ …pe… vayadhammaṃ vedanaṃ …pe… ‘samudayavayadhammā vedanā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.

sn22.127:2.4.pli: samudayadhamme saṅkhāre …pe… vayadhamme saṅkhāre …pe… samudayavayadhamme saṅkhāre ‘samudayavayadhammā saṅkhārā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.

sn22.127:2.5.pli: Samudayadhammaṃ viññāṇaṃ …pe… samudayavayadhammaṃ viññāṇaṃ ‘samudayavayadhammaṃ viññāṇan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
sn22.127:2.5.eng: consciousness, which is liable to originate … liable to fall … liable to originate and fall, as consciousness which is liable to originate and fall.

sn22.127:2.7.eng: And this is how an ignorant person is defined.”

sn22.13:1.2.pli: “Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ, vedanā dukkhā, saññā dukkhā, saṅkhārā dukkhā, viññāṇaṃ dukkhaṃ.
sn22.13:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are suffering.

sn22.13:1.4.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn22.135:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:

sn22.135:1.3.eng: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, they speak of this thing called ‘ignorance’.

sn22.135:1.5.eng: And how is an ignorant person defined?”

sn22.135:2.1.pli: “Idhāvuso, assutavā puthujjano rūpaṃ nappajānāti, rūpasamudayaṃ nappajānāti, rūpanirodhaṃ nappajānāti, rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ nappajānāti.
sn22.135:2.1.eng: “Reverend, it’s when an unlearned ordinary person doesn’t understand form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.

sn22.135:2.5.pli: viññāṇaṃ nappajānāti, viññāṇasamudayaṃ nappajānāti, viññāṇanirodhaṃ nappajānāti, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ nappajānāti.
sn22.135:2.5.eng: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.

sn22.135:2.7.eng: And this is how an ignorant person is defined.”

sn22.135:3.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:
sn22.135:3.1.eng: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to him:

sn22.135:3.2.eng: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, they speak of this thing called ‘knowledge’.

sn22.135:3.4.eng: And how is a knowledgeable person defined?”

sn22.135:4.1.pli: “Idhāvuso, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpaṃ pajānāti, rūpasamudayaṃ pajānāti, rūpanirodhaṃ pajānāti, rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti.
sn22.135:4.1.eng: “Reverend, it’s when a learned noble disciple understands form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.

sn22.135:4.5.pli: viññāṇaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇasamudayaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇanirodhaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti.
sn22.135:4.5.eng: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.

sn22.135:4.7.eng: And this is how a knowledgeable person is defined.”

sn22.136:1.2.pli: “Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, kukkuḷaṃ, vedanā kukkuḷā, saññā kukkuḷā, saṅkhārā kukkuḷā, viññāṇaṃ kukkuḷaṃ.
sn22.136:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are burning chaff.
sn22.136:1.2.comm: “Burning chaff” (kukkūla) is the name of a hell (MN 130:21.1). Some later Buddhists argued that this description meant that all conditioned things were nothing but scorching pain with no pleasure at all, against which the Theravadins cited a series of Sutta texts (Kv 2.8). Compare SN 22.60.

sn22.136:1.3.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmimpi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati, saññāyapi nibbindati, saṅkhāresupi nibbindati, viññāṇasmimpi nibbindati.
sn22.136:1.3.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

sn22.136:1.4.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati. Vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn22.136:1.4.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn22.136:1.5.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn22.136:1.5.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn22.137:1.2.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo chando pahātabbo.
sn22.137:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up desire for what is impermanent.

sn22.137:1.4.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo chando pahātabbo.
sn22.137:1.4.eng: Form is impermanent; you should give up desire for it.

sn22.137:1.8.pli: viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ; tatra vo chando pahātabbo.
sn22.137:1.8.eng: Consciousness is impermanent; you should give up desire for it.

sn22.137:1.9.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo chando pahātabbo”ti.
sn22.137:1.9.eng: You should give up desire for what is impermanent.”

sn22.138:1.2.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.138:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up greed for what is impermanent.

sn22.138:1.4.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.138:1.4.eng: Form is impermanent; you should give up greed for it.

sn22.138:1.8.pli: viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.138:1.8.eng: Consciousness is impermanent; you should give up greed for it.

sn22.138:1.9.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo”ti.
sn22.138:1.9.eng: You should give up greed for what is impermanent.”

sn22.139:1.2.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.139:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up desire and greed for what is impermanent.

sn22.139:1.4.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ, tatra vo chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.139:1.4.eng: Form is impermanent; you should give up desire and greed for it.

sn22.139:1.8.pli: viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ; tatra vo chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.139:1.8.eng: Consciousness is impermanent; you should give up desire and greed for it.

sn22.139:1.9.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ; tatra vo chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.
sn22.139:1.9.eng: You should give up desire and greed for what is impermanent.”

sn22.14:1.2.pli: “Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā, vedanā anattā, saññā anattā, saṅkhārā anattā, viññāṇaṃ anattā.
sn22.14:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are not-self.

sn22.14:1.3.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmimpi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati, saññāyapi nibbindati, saṅkhāresupi nibbindati, viññāṇasmimpi nibbindati.
sn22.14:1.3.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

sn22.14:1.4.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati. Vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn22.14:1.4.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn22.14:1.5.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn22.14:1.5.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn22.140:1.2.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ; tatra vo chando pahātabbo …pe…
sn22.140:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up desire for what is suffering. …”

sn22.143:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up desire for what is not-self. …”

sn22.143:1.9.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, anattā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo”ti.

sn22.144:1.2.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, anattā; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo.
sn22.144:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up greed for what is not-self. …”

sn22.144:1.4.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo.

sn22.144:1.8.pli: viññāṇaṃ anattā; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo.

sn22.144:1.9.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, anattā; tatra vo rāgo pahātabbo”ti.
